title: Use sentence case for headings
description: Capitalize only the first word and proper nouns in headings unless your style guide specifies otherwise.

title: Use numbered lists for sequential steps
description: Use a numbered list when the order of steps matters, such as in procedures.

examples.incorrect:
• Click Start
• Select Settings
• Click Update
examples.correct:
1. Click Start.
2. Select Settings.
3. Click Update.

title: Use bulleted lists for unordered items
description: Use a bulleted list when the order of items does not matter.

title: Format UI elements in bold
description: Use bold to format names of buttons, menus, and commands.

title: Format file names and paths in italics or monospace
description: Use a monospace font or italics for file names and paths to distinguish them from surrounding text.
source: Microsoft Style Guide, Code and File Names section

title: Use code blocks for multi-line code samples
description: When showing multi-line code, use a fenced code block with language syntax highlighting.
source: Microsoft Style Guide, Code Samples section

title: Avoid underlining for emphasis
description: Use bold or italics for emphasis, as underlining can be mistaken for hyperlinks.

title: Keep line length under 80 characters for code examples
description: Wrap long code lines to improve readability and avoid horizontal scrolling.

examples.incorrect: SELECT column1, column2, column3, column4, column5, column6 FROM table_name WHERE condition = true;
examples.correct:
SELECT column1, column2, column3, column4, column5,
       column6 FROM table_name WHERE condition = true;

source: Microsoft Style Guide, Code Formatting section

title: Use tables for structured data
description: Present data in tables when it involves multiple attributes or comparisons.

examples.incorrect: Plan A: $10/month, Basic features. Plan B: $20/month, Advanced features.
examples.correct:
| Plan | Price | Features |
|------|-------|----------|
| A    | $10   | Basic    |
| B    | $20   | Advanced |

title: Use consistent indentation
description: Use consistent indentation in lists, code, and nested content for visual clarity.

examples.incorrect:
1. Step one
    2. Step two
  3. Step three
examples.correct:
1. Step one
2. Step two
3. Step three

title: Use italics for UI messages and placeholders
description: Format system messages or placeholder text in italics to distinguish them from user input.

examples.incorrect: Enter your name in the field labeled Name.
examples.correct: Enter your name in the field labeled *Name*.

source: Microsoft Style Guide, UI Text section

title: Capitalize only UI labels as they appear
description: Write UI element labels exactly as they appear in the software, including capitalization.
source: Microsoft Style Guide, UI Formatting section

title: Use consistent spacing after punctuation
description: Use one space after periods, commas, and colons.

examples.incorrect: Click Save.  Then close the window.
examples.correct: Click Save. Then close the window.

title: Keep headings and subheadings concise
description: Use short, descriptive headings to help readers scan content quickly.

examples.incorrect: How to change the settings in the application to improve performance

title: Avoid manual numbering in text
description: Use auto-numbered lists instead of typing numbers manually to prevent errors when updating content.
